title: Trump warns Iran of ‘bad things’ if no deal made, sets deadline of 10-15 days
byline: President Donald Trump warned Iran on Thursday it must make a deal over its nuclear program or “really bad things” will happen, and set a deadline of 10 to 15 days, drawing a threat from Tehran to retaliate against US bases in the region if attacked.

title: King Charles’ brother Andrew released after arrest over misconduct relating to Epstein
byline: King Charles’ younger brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was released from police custody on Thursday evening after being arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office over allegations he sent confidential government documents to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces today (20), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Maha Sangha Conference to be held in Colombo today
byline: A Maha Sangha Conference is scheduled to be held today (20) with the objective of educating the public regarding the alleged pressures currently being exerted on Buddhism and the Maha Sangha in the country.

title: Three police officers suspended after female suspect escapes from custody
byline: Two police sergeants and a female police constable have been suspended in connection with the escape of a female drug trafficking suspect who was in custody at the Mount Lavinia Police Station under a detention order.

title: 11-member parliamentary select committee appointed to review PC electoral system
byline: A 11-member Special Parliamentary Select Committee has been appointed to investigate and report on the electoral system under which Provincial Council elections should be conducted, and to submit relevant proposals and recommendations.

title: The Chinese AI app sending Hollywood into a panic
byline: A new artificial intelligence (AI) model developed by the Chinese company behind TikTok rocked Hollywood this week - not just because of what it can do, but what it could mean for creative industries.

title: Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Act gazetted
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has officially gazetted the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Act, No. 5 of 2026, certified on 17 February 2026 and published in the Government Gazette on 20 February 2026.

title: Landslide warnings issued for multiple areas in two districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for several areas in the Nuwara Eliya District and Badulla District.

title: Two arrested for aiding and abetting attempted murder in Kalutara
byline: The Kalutara Crimes Division has arrested two individuals in connection with aiding and abetting an attempted murder carried out by shooting.

title: Property worth over Rs. 30 mln frozen in Walasmulla over alleged illegal acquisition
byline: The Illegal Assets Investigation Division has frozen property valued at over Rs. 30 million following allegations that it was acquired through illegal means.

title: Grey’s Anatomy star Eric Dane dies at 53 after ALS diagnosis
byline: Eric Dane, the actor best known for his roles on Grey’s Anatomy and Euphoria, has died less than a year after revealing he had amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). He was 53.

title: Maithree Wickremesinghe to appear before CID today?
byline: Maithree Wickremesinghe, the wife of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, was notified to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (20).

title: Anusha Palpita granted bail
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Mass Media and former Chairman of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Anusha Palpita, has been granted bail by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Writ seeking order to prevent demolition of portion of Trinco Bodhiraja temple recalled
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that the writ petition filed by the Chief Incumbent of the Trincomalee Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya be recalled on April 28.

title: One gunman identified in Akuregoda double murder: Public Security Minister
byline: One of the two shooters involved in the killing of a lawyer and his wife at Akuregoda, as well as the driver who transported them to the lodge where they stayed, has been identified, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today (20).

title: Suspect arrested with 21,000 narcotic pills worth nearly Rs. 3 mln
byline: A suspect was arrested in the Thotalaga area while in possession of a large quantity of narcotic pills, allegedly used by drug addicts as a substitute for heroin and crystal methamphetamine, commonly known as “Ice.”

title: US and Indonesia finalise deal to cut tariffs to 19%
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration and the Indonesian government say they have finalised an agreement to lower US tariffs on the South East Asian country to 19% from 32%.

title: Tommy Shelby returns in Netflix’s official trailer for ‘Peaky Blinders: The Immortal Man’
byline: Netflix has officially released the first trailer for Peaky Blinders: The Immortal Man.

title: Minister Wijepala discloses details of illegally acquired assets frozen since Sept. 2025
byline: The Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala, today (20) disclosed in Parliament details of property and assets acquired through illegal activities by suspects arrested in raids conducted since September last year.

title: Akuregoda double murder: Police obtain 90-day detention order on ‘Polgasowita Dila’
byline: Police have obtained a 90-day detention order to interrogate the 28-year-old suspect known as “Polgasowita Dila,” who is believed to have transported the weapons used in the recent double homicide of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda.

title: UK police search royal mansion as investigation into king’s brother goes on
byline: British police were searching the former mansion of King Charles’ younger brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor on Friday after a photograph of the royal emerging from a police station was splashed on newspapers around the world.

title: Three including woman arrested over separate foreign employment scams
byline: Three individuals have been arrested by the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) for allegedly operating fraudulent foreign employment agencies under the pretext of providing visa consultancy services.

title: Minister says information on politicians with links to underworld to be revealed after probe
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala stated in Parliament today (20) that information has been uncovered regarding certain politicians who allegedly had links with several underworld criminal figures, including Mandinu Padmasiri alias ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’.

title: Revenue from Sri Lanka’s botanical gardens surpasses Rs. 1 bln in 2025
byline: The Department of National Botanic Gardens states that the income generated from the country’s botanical gardens exceeded Rs. 1 billion in the past year.

title: Mystery donor gives Japanese city $3.6m in gold bars to fix water system
byline: A Japanese city has received a hefty donation to help fix its ageing water system: 21kg (46lb) in gold bars.

title: Three suspects including Addtl. GM of Water Board granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered the release on bail of the Additional General Manager of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB), Darshana Medawatte and two other suspects who were remanded in custody over corruption charges.

title: Trump directs US government to prepare release of files on aliens and UFOs
byline: US President Donald Trump says he will direct US agencies, including the defence department, to “begin the process of identifying and releasing” government files on aliens and extraterrestrial life.

title: Meta to shut down Messenger web in April 2026
byline: Meta is set to discontinue the standalone Messenger website. According to the company’s update on its help page, the Messenger website (messenger.com) will stop working from April 2026.

title: Microsoft error sees confidential emails exposed to AI tool Copilot
byline: Microsoft has acknowledged an error causing its AI work assistant to access and summarise some users’ confidential emails by mistake.

title: Showery conditions to enhance tomorrow – Met. Department
byline: Atmospheric  conditions  are  favorable  for  thundershowers  over  most  parts  of  the  island  and showery conditions are expected to enhance tomorrow (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: President Anura Kumara holds bilateral meeting with Indian PM Modi
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday met Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in New Delhi.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Southern provinces.

title: Maha Sangha Conference commences in Colombo
byline: A Maha Sangha Conference commenced today with the objective of educating the public regarding the alleged pressures currently being exerted on Buddhism and the Maha Sangha in the country.

title: South Korea’s ex-President Yoon apologises after life sentence over martial law
byline: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol apologised on Friday for his short-lived declaration of martial law in December 2024, a day after a Seoul court sentenced him to life in prison for masterminding an insurrection.

title: One woman dead, 4 including Indian tourists injured in bus accident in Yatiyanthota
byline: A bus accident had reportedly occurred today (20) along the Hatton–Colombo main road in the Thanakolawatta area of Yatiyanthota.

title: Hearing of ‘Sathosa’ case against ex-minister Johnston postponed to March 11
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that further hearing of the case filed against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others be postponed until March 11, 2026.

title: Former Minister Johnston and sons further remanded
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando, his two sons, and another suspect, who were arrested and remanded on charges of misusing a Sathosa-owned lorry, have been ordered to be further remanded until March 6 by the Wattala Magistrate’s Court.

title: Nearly 100,000 arrested so far in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: Nearly 100,000 suspects have been arrested so far during islandwide raids conducted under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Maha Sangha Conference decides to present 10-point charter to the President
byline: The Maha Sangha Conference, aimed at educating the public regarding the alleged pressures exerted on Buddhism and the Maha Sangha, was held in Colombo this afternoon (20).

title: President Dissanayake returns after attending AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Sri Lankan delegation have returned to Sri Lanka after attending the AI Impact Summit 2026 held in New Delhi, India.

title: Police seek public assistance to arrest suspect in Akuregoda double murder
byline: Sri Lanka Police are seeking public assistance to arrest a suspect wanted in connection with the recent double homicide of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregeoda, Thalangama.

title: Container congestion re-emerges at Colombo Port amid inefficient clearance procedures?
byline: The Chairman of the Container Transport Owners’ Association (CTOA), Sanath Manjula has raised concerns over the re-emergence of container truck congestion at the Colombo Port, due to the absence of an efficient system for container clearance procedures.

title: Magistrate orders swift probe and arrests over Grade 6 English Module case
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has been directed to immediately expedite investigations into the controversial Grade 6 module and to take prompt action to arrest the suspects responsible.

title: US Supreme Court rules that Trump’s sweeping emergency tariffs are illegal
byline: The Supreme Court on Friday ruled that President Donald Trump violated federal law when he unilaterally imposed sweeping tariffs across the globe, a striking loss for the White House on an issue that has been central to the president’s foreign policy and economic agenda.
